content:
3.59 
Matters to be settled by the court on dissolution of the marriage 
The court must, on dissolution of the marriage, determine the place of residence of the minor children of the spouses, the arrangements for participation in their upbringing and for the minor children's access to the separated parent, and settle the issues of maintenance of the minor children of the spouses, as well as the maintenance of one of the spouses and the division of the property of the spouses together, except where the property has been divided by common agreement between the spouses, certified by notarial act.
